title: How to Make Chorizo and Eggs

steps.headline: Preheat the oil to 375F if you have a deep fryer.
steps.description: If not, you can use a frying pan with oil to fry them.

steps.headline: Once the oil is hot, use a large spoon and begin by carefully lowering the potatoes in the oil to fry.
Fry the potatoes for 4–5 minutes or until they are golden brown.
Using a large spoon remove the cooked potatoes and place onto kitchen roll to soak up any excess oil.
steps.description: Add a little salt and pepper to them for flavor to the fried potatoes.

steps.headline: Crack the eggs into a bowl and season the eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Using a whisk or large fork beat the eggs lightly until they are combined.
Heat the deep fryer or frying pan and when hot add the chorizo.
Using the spoon gently place the chorizo into the fryer or frying pan and fry for 5–6 minutes.
steps.description: Make sure you are stirring it well while frying until chorizo is completely cooked. Drain the excess fat onto kitchen roll when done.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 150c to ensure it is warn enough to warm the tortillas.
Add the chorizo into a large bowl and add the eggs to the chorizo.
Add more oil if necessary to the frying pan and heat the frying pan on low.
steps.description: Consider adding some butter for a more creamy texture to the scrambled eggs.

steps.headline: Add the eggs and chorizo mixture to the pan and slowly stir with the wooden spoon until almost cooked.
Add the potatoes.
steps.description: Begin mixing all the ingredients together while scrambling the eggs completely.

steps.headline: Place the tortillas onto a baking tray and place into the warm oven to heat for 5 minutes.
When all the ingredients are cooked, add the egg and chorizo mixture evenly into each
steps.description: Add hot sauce or jalapeños if you'd like for more flavoring.

Using a large spoon remove the cooked potatoes and place onto kitchen roll to soak up any excess oil. Add a little salt and pepper to them for flavor to the fried potatoes. Heat the deep fryer or frying pan and when hot add the chorizo.  Using the spoon gently place the chorizo into the fryer or frying pan and fry for 5–6 minutes. Make sure you are stirring it well while frying until chorizo is completely cooked. Drain the excess fat onto kitchen roll when done. Preheat the oven to 150c to ensure it is warn enough to warm the tortillas.  Add the chorizo into a large bowl and add the eggs to the chorizo.  Add more oil if necessary to the frying pan and heat the frying pan on low. Consider adding some butter for a more creamy texture to the scrambled eggs. Add the eggs and chorizo mixture to the pan and slowly stir with the wooden spoon until almost cooked.  Add the potatoes. Begin mixing all the ingredients together while scrambling the eggs completely. Place the tortillas onto a baking tray and place into the warm oven to heat for 5 minutes.  When all the ingredients are cooked, add the egg and chorizo mixture evenly into each Add hot sauce or jalapeños if you'd like for more flavoring.
